translated: Points of Controversy
The Fifty on Predispositions
Tenth Section
The Discussion on Cessations

original: Upapattesiye pañcakkhandhe aniruddhe kiriyā pañcakkhandhā uppajjantīti?
analyzed: upapattesiye pañca kkhandhe a niruddhe kiriyā pañca kkhandhāḥ uppajjanti iti
translated: When the five aggregates are unceased in rebirth-linking, do the five aggregates of action arise?
“Yes.”

original: Dasannaṁ khandhānaṁ samodhānaṁ hoti, dasa khandhā sammukhībhāvaṁ āgacchantīti?
analyzed: dasannam khandhānam samodhānam hoti dasa khandhāḥ sammukhībhāvam āgacchanti iti
translated: “Is there a coming together of ten aggregates, do ten aggregates come into focus?”
“That can’t be said.”

original: dasannaṁ khandhānaṁ samodhānaṁ hoti, dasa khandhā sammukhībhāvaṁ āgacchantīti?
analyzed: dasannam khandhānam samodhānam hoti dasa khandhāḥ sammukhībhāvam āgacchanti iti
translated: “Is there a coming together of ten aggregates, do ten aggregates come into focus?”🔽“Yes.”

original: Āmantā. dvinnaṁ phassānaṁ …pe… dvinnaṁ cittānaṁ samodhānaṁ hotīti?
analyzed: āmantā dvinnam phassānam pe dvinnam cittānam samodhānam hoti iti
translated: “Is there a coming together of two contacts … of two kinds of consciousness?”
“That can’t be said.”

original: Upapattesiye pañcakkhandhe aniruddhe kiriyā cattāro khandhā uppajjantīti?
analyzed: upapattesiye pañca khandhe aniruddhe kiriyā cattāro khandhāḥ uppajjanti iti
translated: When the five aggregates are unceased in rebirth-linking, do the four aggregates of action arise?
“Yes.”

original: Navannaṁ khandhānaṁ samodhānaṁ hoti, nava khandhā sammukhībhāvaṁ āgacchantīti?
analyzed: navannam khandhānam samodhānam hoti nava khandhā sammukhībhāvam āgacchanti iti
translated: “Is there a coming together of nine aggregates, do nine aggregates come into focus?”
“That can’t be said.”

original: navannaṁ khandhānaṁ samodhānaṁ hoti, nava khandhā sammukhībhāvaṁ āgacchantīti?
analyzed: navannam khandhānam samodhānam hoti nava khandhā sammukhībhāvam āgacchanti iti
translated: “Is there a coming together of nine aggregates, do nine aggregates come into focus?”

original: Āmantā. dvinnaṁ phassānaṁ …pe… dvinnaṁ cittānaṁ samodhānaṁ hotīti?
analyzed: āmantā dvinnam phassānam pe dvinnam cittānam samodhānam hoti iti
translated: “Is there a meeting together of two kinds of contact … of two kinds of consciousness?”
“That can’t be said.”

analyzed: upapattesiye pañca kkhandhe aniruddhe kiriyā ñāṇam uppajjati iti
translated: “When the five aggregates are unceased, does a consciousness that is a result of prior action arise?”
“Yes.”

original: Channaṁ khandhānaṁ samodhānaṁ hoti, cha khandhā sammukhībhāvaṁ āgacchantīti?
analyzed: channam khandhānam samodhānam hoti cha khandhā sammukhībhāvam āgacchanti iti
translated: “Is there a meeting together of the six elements, do the six sense spheres come into the present?”
“That can’t be said.”

original: channaṁ khandhānaṁ samodhānaṁ hoti, cha khandhā sammukhībhāvaṁ āgacchantīti?
analyzed: channam khandhānam samodhānam hoti cha khandhā sammukhībhāvam āgacchanti iti
translated: “Is there a meeting together of the six elements, do the six sense spheres come into the present?”🔽“Yes.”

original: Āmantā. dvinnaṁ phassānaṁ …pe… dvinnaṁ cittānaṁ samodhānaṁ hotīti?
analyzed: āmantā dvinnam phassānam pe dvinnam cittānam samodhānam hoti iti
translated: “Is there a meeting together of two kinds of contact … of two kinds of consciousness?”
“That can’t be said.”

analyzed: upapattesiye pañca kkhandhe niruddhe maggaḥ uppajjati iti
translated: “When the five aggregates have ceased, does the path arise?”
“Yes.”

original: Mato maggaṁ bhāveti, kālaṅkato maggaṁ bhāvetīti?
analyzed: mataḥ maggam bhāveti kālaṅkataḥ maggam bhāveti iti
translated: “Does one develop the path after death? Does one develop the path when dead?”
“That can’t be said.”
The Discussion of Cessation is finished.
